intro: Adenophora triphylla f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth腺草, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This variety is distinguished by its glabrous (smooth) foliage, which sets it apart from other forms of Adenophora triphylla.
